subject: Law
title: Reparations and Restorative Justice
description: A short lesson to help you apply Reparations and Restorative Justice.

hook.text: Slavery ended 160 years ago. Should the government compensate descendants? The debate is older than you think.

buildup.text: Reparations are payments or programs meant to address historic injustices like slavery and segregation.

discovery.text: HR 40, introduced since 1989, would create a commission to study reparations. It has never passed Congress.

twist.text: Some cities have acted alone. Evanston, Illinois became the first US city to fund a reparations program in 2021.

climax.text: Supporters cite the lasting wealth gap. Opponents question logistics and fairness across generations.

punchline.text: History left a debt. Whether the law repays it is the open question.
